<title level="1" pfs="">[Tar Ooze](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1815)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

When creatures carrying magical items die in a tar pit, the magic mixes with the tar itself. Over centuries, this energy animates the tar into a relentless and horrifying ooze.

 Tar oozes begin their existence in tar pits, naturally occurring lakes of thick and sticky petroleum. Tar pits make effective traps for animals and humanoids alike, as they're often covered with thin layers of dirt or grass or reflect sunlight in a way that resembles a watering hole. Once a creature steps or falls into the sticky tar of the pit, escape is all but impossible. Slowly, the caught creature—and any other victims lured near by its plaintive cries—sinks into the tar, suffocates, and dies.

 Magic inherent in a captive creature or carried in powerful magic items carried by the dead remains inside the tar, where it gathers, mixes, and slowly energizes it until it begins to move and seek prey. A tar ooze seeps slowly over the land, catching anything it touches in a sticky embrace and devouring it.

 Living things consumed by the ooze slowly have their flesh digested, only for the bones and fur to be replaced with blobs of sticky tar. These unnatural zombies eventually crawl away, hungry for flesh. Without a master to give them instructions, these [tar zombies](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=303) often follow the ooze that created them, swarming anyone bold or foolish enough to get in their way.

<title level="2" right="Creature 10">[Tar Ooze](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1815)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
<trait label="Ooze" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=122" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #177: Burning Tundra](/Sources.aspx?ID=116) pg. 82</row>

**Perception** +18; motion sense 60 feet, no vision

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +23, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +13

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** -3

**Con** +8

**Int** -5

**Wis** +0

**Cha** -5
</row>

**Motion Sense** A tar ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and movement.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +10 

**Will** +15 

</row>

**HP** 255

**Immunities**
critical hits, [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10

**Sticky** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The tar ooze is hit by a melee attack; **Effect** The ooze attempts to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) the creature that hit it. The ooze must still spend an action to extend the duration of the Grab on subsequent rounds, as normal.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 15 feet, climb 10 feet; viscous sludge

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
pseudopod +23 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+14 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**[Engulf](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14)** <actions string="Two Actions" />  DC 29, 6d6 bludgeoning, [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 29, Rupture 17

**Viscous Sludge**   The tar ooze can have up to eight creatures grappled at the same time; doing so doesn't prevent it from making pseudopod Strikes. A tar ooze can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain.

**Zombification**  ([Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Ooze](/Traits.aspx?ID=122)) A creature slain while engulfed by a tar ooze undergoes a horrifying transformation and crawls from the ooze a week later as a [tar zombie](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=303).

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Tar Ooze Treasure</title>

A tar ooze is animated by the mixed magical auras of creatures and items trapped within it. Unlike most oozes, a tar ooze isn't acidic; it is massive, however, and objects caught inside are subjected to great pressure and force as the tar ooze moves. Anything small and hard— such as coins, jewels, rings, and [_aeon stones_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=407)—are especially likely to remain relatively undamaged inside a tar ooze. Other metal objects, including most weapons and armor, are also likely to survive, though some might need repair.
</aside>
